result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Virgil Hoyt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

records.addlTxt: 11:21 AM Defendant Randall Virgil Hoyt in court in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count one. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders 10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, 5 Prison with 5  years Extended Supervision. $600 fine plus costs-DOC COLLECT, Driver license revoked for 3 years, Ignition Interlock for 3 years,Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. Felony rights given to defendant. Remaining counts are dismissed and read in. Sentence is consecutive to 07CF2832.  Defendant is eligible for Substance abuse program. 0 days credit.  Money seized to be applied to fine/costs, state to prepare order.
